convs.question: Blake: What are you, a detective? Don’t jump to conclusions, you’ve only seen one side of the story and let’s face it no one here is innocent. It’ll be better if we cooperate.

options.txt: I just want to know the truth

convs.question: Blake: Ahaha, you want the truth?
Blake: Don’t act the fool.
Joe: Well it seems everyone here knows he’s a detective. Look, there’s no point beating round the bush, Blake is the one who created and spread the virus.
Blake: Is this really all my fault?
Shawn: Then why did you need the SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV reports? Why did you take the incubator out of the lab?
Tom: Detective, I think you should have gathered more evidence.
Blake: They’re all in collusion, do you really believe them?

options.txt: Please tell me the reason for talking the incubator

convs.question: Joe: It’s no use denying that Blake is the one at the center of the virus, the evidence is conclusive.
Shawn: The incubator and the reports.
Tom: And he also went to ITALY a few weeks ago.
Blake: Nobody cares who actually is to blame as long as there’s a scapegoat. I will give you guys my research findings, then why not let this outsider — the so called detective, be the scapegoat?
Joe: Emmm, okay.
Blake: (takes a breath) I did. But everyone is responsible for this.
Blake: Tom was the first to study the virus, and Joe helped him. Shawn helped them keep up the good guy facade and avoid offending anyone.
Joe: Do you really believe they want the truth? The people who sent you here just want a scapegoat!
Shawn: Detective, they could even pin it on you.
Shawn: One person on their own cannot convince the whole public.
Shawn: Detective, make your decision carefully
